key_points: CNN producer John Griffin has been fired after being indicted for attempting to lure young girls for 'sexual subservience' training.
Griffin worked closely with ex-anchor Chris Cuomo and was indicted by a federal grand jury in Vermont.
He is accused of trying to induce minors to engage in unlawful sexual activity and faces a mandatory minimum of 10 years for each of the three counts.
Griffin allegedly attempted to lure at least four girls, ages 16, 14, 13, and 9, to his Vermont ski house.
He reportedly offered a mother $3,000 to bring her 9-year-old daughter from Nevada to Vermont, where the girl was engaged in unlawful sexual activity.
The mother, Heather Carriker, was arrested and charged with multiple counts related to child abuse and sexual assault.
Griffin boasted about his work with Chris Cuomo on LinkedIn.
He used social media platforms like Kik and Google Hangout to entice two other children into sexual activity.
Federal authorities are seeking forfeiture of Griffin's home and his Tesla, which were allegedly used in committing the crimes.
Griffin's arrest and subsequent firing from CNN bring attention to the serious allegations of exploiting minors.
